example: There was litter all over the park after the festival.
logic: 随手乱扔的“零碎”垃圾

example: Don't leave your trash on the beach.
logic: 美式英语，侧重于无用的干杂物

example: He threw the garbage bag into the dumpster.
logic: 源自厨房或潮湿的废弃物

example: Please put your rubbish in the bin.
logic: 英式英语对废物的通用称呼

example: The sewage system in this area needs to be upgraded.
logic: SEWER (下水道) 排出的物质

example: Proper sewage treatment is essential for public health.
logic: 对脏水进行理化“对待/处理”

example: Wastewater from factories can pollute nearby rivers.
logic: 工业或生活用过后“废掉”的水

example: Many countries face a severe water shortage.
logic: 供应低于需求的“短处”状态

example: Desertification is a growing issue in many parts of the world.
logic: DESERT (沙漠) + IFICATION (动作过程)

example: Deforestation is threatening biodiversity worldwide.
logic: DE (去掉) + FOREST (森林)

example: Afforestation can help combat climate change.
logic: AF (去/使) + FOREST (森林) - 增加绿化

example: Acid rain damages crops and buildings over time.
logic: PH值呈酸性的破坏性降雨

example: Please throw the empty cans in the bin.
logic: 存放废弃物的容器（英常用）

example: I bought a can of soda from the vending machine.
logic: 密封的金属圆柱容器

example: We should recycle as much as possible to reduce waste.
logic: RE (重新) + CYCLE (循环)

example: The Sahara is the largest desert in the world.
logic: DE (离开) + SERT (连接) - 被遗弃的荒原

example: Chocolate cake is my favorite dessert.
logic: DES (撤走) + SERV (正餐) - 正餐撤走后的美餐

example: The sewer system under the city is being repaired.
logic: 引导污水流动的地下管道

example: Vinegar is a weak acid commonly used in cooking.
logic: AC (尖/酸) - 具有酸性的物质

example: The conservation of wildlife is essential for biodiversity.
logic: CON (共同) + SERV (保持) - 完整保存

example: Waste sorting helps to increase recycling rates.
logic: 按种类 (SORT) 拨开垃圾

example: Solar and wind are examples of renewable energy sources.
logic: RE (再) + NEW (新) - 可更新的能源

example: Wind energy is a clean source of renewable power.
logic: 利用空气流动转化的能量

example: Solar energy can be used to power homes and businesses.
logic: SOL (太阳) 辐射带来的能量

example: Tidal energy harnesses the power of ocean tides to generate electricity.
logic: 利用海水涨落 (TIDE) 的动能

example: Geothermal energy is derived from the heat inside the Earth.
logic: GEO (地) + THERM (热) - 地壳内部热能

example: Coal and oil are examples of non-renewable energy sources.
logic: 用一点少一点，无法“再新”

example: Fossil fuels such as coal, oil, and natural gas are non-renewable.
logic: FOSS (挖) - 从地下挖出来的古代遗骸

example: Coal is often used in power plants to generate electricity.
logic: 固态矿物燃料

example: Coal is sometimes referred to as black diamond due to its value.
logic: 比喻煤炭的高额经济价值

example: Oil is one of the most important fossil fuels in the world.
logic: 液态化石燃料

example: Oil is often called black gold because of its economic value.
logic: 形容石油像黄金一样珍贵

example: Gasoline is a common fuel used in cars.
logic: 提供能量进行燃烧的物质

example: In many countries, petrol is used as the fuel for cars.
logic: PETR (石) + OL (油) - 英式说法

example: The car runs on gasoline, which is stored in the tank.
logic: 美式说法，指易燃液体

example: Natural gas is often used for heating and electricity generation.
logic: 气态的化石能源

example: Nuclear energy is used in some countries to produce electricity.
logic: 原子核 (NUCLEUS) 裂变/聚变能

example: The company was established in 1995.
logic: STABL (稳定) - 使系统稳定运行

example: If you're unsure, you should consult an expert.
logic: CON (共同) + SULT (跳/讨论) - 共同商议

example: She advocates for clean energy solutions.
logic: AD (去) + VOC (声音) - 发出呼吁的声音

example: The government is promoting the use of renewable energy.
logic: PRO (向前) + MOT (移动) - 推动进程
